tidbits.title: Pamir Mountains
tidbits.description: Tajikistan is home to a significant portion of the Pamir Mountains, often referred to as the 'Roof of the World,' offering stunning landscapes and challenging treks.

tidbits.title: Cultural Heritage
tidbits.description: The country has a rich cultural heritage shaped by Persian, Islamic, and Soviet influences, reflected in its arts, music, dance, and traditional crafts.

tidbits.title: Ancient Silk Road
tidbits.description: Tajikistan was a part of the ancient Silk Road, hosting historic trade routes and archaeological sites like Sarazm, recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
